intro: Stiza psiloloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stiza, is a herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features slender, upright stems with finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a soft, silky hair. Its small, yellowish-white flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Stiza psiloloba is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
